meanings.definition: A person who travels on foot with a pack or packs.
meanings.sent1: The packmen journeyed through the forest with their heavy packs.
meanings.sent2: The packmen walked along the trail carrying their backpacks.
meanings.sent3: The packmen joked about their sore shoulders from carrying their packs all day.
meanings.sent4: The packmen were like modern-day nomads, roaming the countryside with their packs.
meanings.sent5: The image of the packmen trudging through the wilderness stayed with me.

meanings.definition: A person who sells goods from a pack.
meanings.sent1: The packmen set up their stalls in the market, displaying their wares.
meanings.sent2: The packmen offered a variety of items from their packs to the customers.
meanings.sent3: The packmen's mobile shop was a hit among the locals.
meanings.sent4: The packmen transformed the street into a bustling marketplace with their packs.
meanings.sent5: The colorful packs of the packmen caught the attention of passersby.

meanings.definition: A person who carries a pack for a living.
meanings.sent1: The packmen made a living by transporting goods for others.
meanings.sent2: The packmen earned their wages by shouldering heavy loads every day.
meanings.sent3: The packmen's job was to ensure the safe delivery of packages to their destinations.
meanings.sent4: The packmen were the unsung heroes of the delivery industry.
meanings.sent5: The dedication of the packmen to their profession was admirable.
